item.title: Someone helo with my mod/admin hangout :(
item.dc:creator: @pur3str_pk2 pur3str pk2
item.description:
@pur3str_pk2 wrote:

Purpose: Making someone on your server mods/admin (yourself too)

Difficulty: 1/100

Assumed Knowledge: Copy&paste, and know how your brain works.

Server Base: Testscape, but could be on other sources too.

Classes Modified: Client.java

Procedure
Step 1: [i]Open up your Client.java and search for: admin list.Then you’ll see this: [code] //start of moderator/admin list, 1 = mod, 2 = staff, 3 = admin
if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“a name”))
{
playerRights = 3;
}

else if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(""))
{
playerRights = 3;
}

else if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“a name”))
{
playerRights = 2;
}
else if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“a name”))
{
playerRights = 2;
}
else if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“a name”))
{
playerRights = 2;
}
else if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“a name”))
{
playerRights = 2;
}
else if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“a name”))
{
playerRights = 2;
}
else if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“a name”))
{
playerRights = 2;
}
else if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“a name”))
{
playerRights = 2;
}
else if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“a name”))
{
playerRights = 2;
}
else if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“a name”))
{
playerRights = 2;
}
else if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“a name”))
{
playerRights = 1;
}
else if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“a name”))
{
playerRights = 1;
}[/code] As you see, at the top of the code, there is playerrights, 3 is owner, 2 is admin and 1 is pmod.

Step 2: There, who you want as owner, put it by 3, and who you want as admin by 2 and who you want as playermod by 1. Typ in the name by ‘a name’. Then save, compile and run!

Step 3: HAVE FUN

Credits: 100% me (pur3str pk2), not leeched. There may be some of these tuts, couldn’t found so I made it.

Read full topic
